intro: Kupeantha spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed kupeantha, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, making it a visually appealing species for ornamental gardening. Kupeantha spathulata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, thriving in warm, dry climates.
